bestBHT.bht: The Son of Man's departure from this world through death is both a fulfillment of God's decrees and the prophecies found in the Scriptures. The one who betrays the Son of Man will not be excused or have their sin lessened, even if they are fulfilling God's plans and fulfilling biblical prophecies. The magnitude of the betrayer's crime and the severity of their punishment are emphasized, suggesting that it would have been more favorable for them to never have been born.

John Gill: The son of man indeed goeth,.... Out of this world by death,
as it is written; both in the book of God's decrees, and in the Scriptures of the Old Testament;
woe to that man by whom the son of man is betrayed! whose sin will not be excused, nor lessened by fulfilling the decrees of God, and by accomplishing the prophecies of the Bible
good were it for that man if he had never been born; so aggravating will be his crime, so dreadful his punishment

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse speaks of the betrayal of the Son of Man. The commentary highlights the fulfillment of God's decrees and the prophecies of the Old Testament, emphasizing that the betrayer's sin will not be excused or lessened. It also warns of the severity of the betrayer's crime and the dreadful punishment that awaits him, suggesting that it would have been better for him to never have been born.

The Son of Man's departure from this world through death is both a fulfillment of God's decrees and the prophecies found in the Scriptures. The one who betrays the Son of Man will not be excused or have their sin lessened, even if they are fulfilling God's plans and fulfilling biblical prophecies. The magnitude of the betrayer's crime and the severity of their punishment are emphasized, suggesting that it would have been more favorable for them to never have been born.

The Son of Man's departure from this world, as prophesied, fulfills God's decrees and Scriptures. However, the betrayer's sin will not be excused or diminished by fulfilling God's plan. The magnitude of the betrayer's crime is emphasized, reflecting the severity of their punishment. It is suggested that it would have been better for this individual to never have been born, underscoring the grievous nature of their offense.
